ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, it's helpful for Physics students.
Phase transitions 102. If this interests you, take it. Otherwise do not.
I would recommend it to a fellow student: I would say it gives a good background for future more advanced study of the topic. It is a good foundation on which to build up for research projects.

This course was a very worthwhile experience, and I would recommend it to all the physics graduate students. The theory becomes pretty abstracted from whatever physical system is under study, and while this abstraction is kind of a neat thing, it also makes it easy for a student to become lost in a lecture or completely miss the point of a homework problem. It took a lot of help talking with some knowledgeable friends for me to get the most out of this course. It's a fascinating class, and I wish that I'd spent more time having those discussions and thinking about the material.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It improved my problem solving abilities.
